characters: OBJECTS FLYING UPWARDS THROUGH THE AIR
ITS SIREN LIGHT FLOODS INTO THE
AN ESCALADE SLAMS INTO THE DRONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COUPLE sleeps on a king size bed. The valley in the thousand count sheets between them is noticeably wide. A strange LIGHT streaks through the closed blinds of the floor-to-ceiling WINDOWS lining the wall beside the bed. Shadows dance over their faces. She stirs. Her name is ELAINE, 20s, a natural beauty.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: How’s it morning already? JARROD rolls over. 20s, thin and darkly handsome. The clo reads: 3:50 A.M. He throws a pillow over his head.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: It’s not. It’s... jet lag. Elaine puts her hand on her stomach. Feeling nauseous. She stumbles across the plush shag carpet towards the bathroom. Opens the glass door. The wrong way at first.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: FLUSH. She exits the bathroom, looking worse for the wear Looks back towards the bed. The LIGHT outside seems to ha grown even brighter. She slowly opens the bedroom door, peeking out in the

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: It’s even brighter in here. And way more expensively decorated. Remnants of last night’s party lie strewn acro the granite counter tops, not to mention RYAN and DENISE, sleeping on the shag and L shaped leather sofa respective Shaking her head, Elaine closes the bedroom door. As she moves onto the bed, the LIGHT outside goes nuclear hot, like someone just switched on the mid day SUN.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Jarrod...

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Morning sickness again?

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: No, look!  Then the building starts SHAKING. He rubs the hangover out of his eyes to see the lights co from behind the blinds. That is weird. He gets up, moving towards the windows. Raising his hand, he begins to open the blinds when- WOMAN’S VOICE (0.S.) Ryan... oh my God... Her shout comes from the LIVING ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What are you- WHOMP. WHOMP. Her voice is drowned out by an odd FREQUENC Jarrod looks to the now intensely frightened Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Stay here.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: I don’t know-

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: He motions for Elaine to stay put as he hustles into the:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is bathed in an EERIE BRIGHT LIGHT. Jarrod has t shield his eyes just to see. DENISE is crouched on the sofa, pure fear on her face.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: He’s gone! Turning to his left, Jarrod peers through the open BALCON DOOR at the strangely beautiful light shining from outsid Jarrod’s HANDS fall to his side, VEINS BULGING outwards. knuckles go white. His pupils as big as quarters and blac night. WHOMP. WHOMP. The FREQUENCY drowns out everything, filli Jarrod’s head with a mesmerizing rhythm, pushing him forw as the LIGHT FLARES OVER HIM.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE
dialogues.text: The frequency gives way to the sound of AIRPLANE ENGINES. The WHITE HOT LIGHT fades, revealing JARROD’S FACE. Eyes closed. Hair flapping in the wind. Smiling. He leans his head back inside the BACK WINDOW of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLASSIC ROCK plays on the radio. He rolls up the window.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: It’s beautiful, huh? Beside him sits ELAINE. She stares out her window, watchi strip malls and power lines streak by.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: (playful) Oh yeah. Breathtaking. He leans over and looks out her window: TACO BELL, KFC, C CASHING, etc.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Okay, I’1l admit. I was expecting more palm trees.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: The Phantom certainly fits the part. They laugh. Look around the car.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Well, Terry said he’d roll out the red carpet but this is insane. She looks at the TWO TELEVISIONS on the seat backs.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: I know, I’m afraid to touch anything. Jarrod stretches his arm across the seat. Pulls her in c

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: I’m not... Gently caresses her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: If you break it you buy it. She playfully pushes him off. But he leans in and kisses tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black Phantom crests a hill, revealing the picturesqu VISTA of the Pacific Ocean, mountains and Marina Del Rey.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Now that’s more like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Phantom pulls into a CUL DE SAC. All sides are flanke modern high rise condos. Straight ahead, center, is THE COVE. The newest and most luxurious. Nineteen stories of glittering glass and steel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before the LIMO DRIVER can even step out, Jarrod swings h door open. He takes Elaine’s hand, helping her out. Toget they look up at the Cove, taking it in. The Limo Driver places a overnight bag on the walk way, a extends the handle. He hands Jarrod a tattered duffel bag Jarrod grabs his wallet, chained to his pants. Thumbs thr three crumpled twenties, a five and lots of singles.

dialogues.speaker: LIMO DRIVER
dialogues.text: It’s all taken care of, sir.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Oh, okay. Thanks. Jarrod rolls Elaine’s bag to the FRONT DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lobby is immaculately furnished. Spotless and new.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: (Smiling) Wow. He lives in a hotel?

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Special effects must pay well. The CONCIERGE’S name tag reads “OLIVER”. Early 40s, world weary. He taps the counter lightly. His ornate WEDDING RI makes a soft click. He speaks in a welcoming voice.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Good afternoon. Welcome to The Cove. How may I assist you?

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Going up to Terry Sergeant's.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Ah, the party, of course. Enjoy yourselves. Oliver and Elaine exchange smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch the LED floor display until it hits ‘19’.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Penthouse. She raises her eyebrow. Jarrod shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine and Jarrod emerge from the elevator bank, almost bumping into a group of bikini clad GIRLS - early 20s.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Excuse us. The girls giggle and pile into the elevator, heading down WORLD MUSIC echoes down the hall as Jarrod and Elaine mak their way to Penthouse six. The DOOR’S OPEN. They walk inside. It’s filled with PEOPLE. A party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The living room, kitchen and lounge are a MASSIVE OPEN RO A marvel of European design. The floor to ceiling windows offer a panoramic view of Los Angeles’ skyline. Jarrod and Elaine wander through the crowd, looking lost.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Smile! FLASH. They turn to see DENISE. A professional SLR CAMERA her hands. Mid 20s. Beautiful and bohemian.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Cute pic. You must be Jarrod. Denise leans forward, kissing both of Jarrod’s cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Denise.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Hey. This is my girlfriend Elaine. Elaine extends her hand to Denise for a shake.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Kisses on the west coast. Denise kisses her on each cheek.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Terry’s around here somewhere. Elaine looks around the penthouse. Her eyes widen. She mo towards a pop art PAINTING. A sexy girl with a gun. DENISE (0.S.) (CONT’D) Mojito’s okay? Elaine turns. Works from the SAME ARTIST are everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: I thought you sold these.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: I did. Technically. Denise interrupts, handing them each a MOJITO.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Aren’t they amazing? Like Andy Warhol meets Jack Kirby. Cheers.  The three clink glasses. Jarrod and Denise imbibe.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey you! Denise recognizes another PARTY GOER and wanders off. Elaine rolls her eyes. Turns to hand Jarrod her untouched drink. He gives her a knowing grin.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: That was polite of you. She smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (LOUD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Brooklyn in the house?! TERRY struts towards them. Early 30s. African American. Chiseled frame. Tank top. Sunglasses. Larger than life.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Look at Mr. California! Terry grabs Jarrod, HUGGING him tight.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Happy birthday man. Damn, forgot how strong you are. Terry pulls away, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: How could you? After that rumble down in the Bowery?

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Hey, I was twice as drunk as you.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (Re: the two mojitos) Careful now, looks like you’re well on your way. Terry launches a playful jab. Even his play feels tough. Elaine is amused by the bro-mance. She stands next to a framed magazine cover of a GORGEOUS MODEL.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me, where are my manners? Terry approaches Elaine, taking her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry. And you must be the one and only Elaine. With that he kisses her hand. Elaine can’t help but smile

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Thank you so much for the ride.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Anything for family. CLACK. CLACK. High heels walk across the wooden floor. They turn to see CANDICE, early 30s. The same gorgeous mo from the framed photo. In a bikini, with a D&G towel arou her waist. Her nose buried in a BLACKBERRY.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, this is my girl Candice. Candice looks up from her blackberry. Extending her hand each of them. Almost too formally.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you. Goes right back to texting.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: As you can see, it’s pool time. Throw your suits on. We’re losing sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pool area is lavish, complete with jacuzzi, fireplace dance area, and outdoor bar. A sea of PARTY PEOPLE mill about: lounging, swimming, drinking. It’s LA incarnate. Candice leads the girls towards the jacuzzi.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (Arm around Jarrod) Bar's this way. Jarrod looks to Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: You good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Club soda. Make it a double. He smiles and heads off with Terry. Denise and Candice lay out their towels and disrobe. Elai watches them reveal their flawless bodies. She caresses h stomach for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrod and Terry lean against the bar, taking in the view cute ASIAN BARTENDER pours them shots. Makes more drinks.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: You really did it man. Just like everyone knew you would.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Couldn't have done it without you.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: What did I do? Decorate your walls?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: They do look nice. They both laugh, toast and down the shots.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Can’t thank you enough for all this. I mean, I’m the one who should be getting you the gift. The bartender serves them each a Margarita. Rocks. Salt.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, I got some ideas on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise has her feet in the Jacuzzi. Scanning the crowd wi her camera. Focuses on Jarrod at the bar. Clicks away.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: So how did you guys meet?

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Believe it or not, my boss set us up.  10. Elaine takes off her T-shirt, revealing a modest, yet flattering bikini. Her body is curvy. Sexy.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: And what is it you do? Elaine sits on the edge of the jacuzzi, legs dipping in.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Publishing.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Anything I’d know?

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: It’s a small firm. Mostly art books.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Cool. I’m a photographer, you know-

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Is there any money in that?

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: It pays the bills. And I love it.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: That’s important, especially ina fading profession.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Well, nothing last forever, right?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Everyone’s gettin’ along famously I see. Terry and Jarrod approach the jacuzzi. Drinks in hand.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Where’s my cosmo? Terry cringes, shrugs. Candice pretends she isn’t enraged CANDICE (CONT’D) Denise? Denise bites her lip. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Anyone else? No takers. She pulls herself out and sulks towards the ba  11. Jarrod sits down next to Elaine, legs soaking in the wate

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Beats December in Brooklyn.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: I don’t know, I kinda like having four seasons.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: We got one of those down the block. Elaine concedes with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But wait until tomorrow- A faint RUMBLING is heard in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We’re gonna take to the high seas on my new Sunseeker.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: For real?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: A 47 footer. Nothing too crazy. Terry raises his voice to compete with the GROWING RUMBLE

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My starter Yacht. The RUMBLE is now THUNDEROUS, drowning out all voices. A SQUADRON OF BLACKHAWK HELICOPTERS PASSES OVERHEAD. Elaine and Jarrod look up in awe. The rest of the party c care less. Candice texts. Terry sips his drink casually. The Blackhawks pass. The rumble fades into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Michael Bay must be coming back from dinner.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Who?  12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party has stepped up a notch. Scantily clad WOMEN min with well dressed MEN. Terry leads Jarrod and Elaine through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Yo Ryan! RYAN swings around. Big grin on his scruffy, yet boyish f He and Terry hug it out.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How’s that robot fight coming along?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: It sucks. But the director loves it. (Looks to Jarrod & Elaine) Oh, is this the boy wonder? And his lovely lady... Ryan toasts to Jarrod then Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Great to finally meet you man. I hear you’re gonna join the crew?

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: (Caught off guard) Huh? I don’t- A surprised Elaine glares at the completely puzzled Jarro

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (To Elaine) Find a spot to live yet? Let me tell you, Venice is the place to be-

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: We'll keep that in mind. Excuse me. She shoots Jarrod a cool glance before leaving.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gotta use the little girl’s room.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Elaine, hold on-

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (Oblivious) Bro, she is smokin’.  13. Terry gives Ryan the stink eye. Puts his arm around Jarro walks him towards the fireplace at the edge of the party.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: What the hell was that about?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Alright man, cat’s out of the bag. (Let’s out a sigh) I was thinking you should come out here. I could use you. Jarrod starts shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, to hell with that. I need you.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: What for? I don’t know anything about effects, man.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: But you have the eye. You know it. Just apply it to something slightly different. Computer’s just a tool. Like a paintbrush. (He takes a sip) Just that my brushes cost 200 grand each. Terry smirks. But Jarrod still isn’t sure.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: I don’t know... I just never saw myself out here.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Come on, man. It’s time to step up. (he takes another sip) Look. There are other artists. Sure. But I need someone I can trust. This whole town is full of flakes. What I need is a brother. Terry puts out for a fist bump. Jarrod leaves him hanging

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: What about Elaine?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Well, I can’t take care of everything.  14. Candice approaches in a stunning dress. Terry winks and t her hand, leading her onto the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vibe is festive. Dancing guests have overflowed into lounge area. Terry and Candice move sensually to the musi Ryan and Denise stand by the edge of the dance area.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: So you want to head upstairs or- Jarrod walks past, looking for Elaine. Denise ignores Ryan, stepping right in front of Jarrod.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Whoa! Watch it. You okay?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: I’m perfect. She downs her cosmo. Smiles with a drunken gaze.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're fun. Denise moves closer to Jarrod. Yelling into his ear.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We don’t get ones like you out here.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: (Sheepish) What are you talking about? She paws his chest and pulls him onto the dance floor. Writhing around Jarrod. He reluctantly moves to the beat. Terry points and laughs. Elaine watches from across the floor, with her arms cross RYAN (0.S. Looks like you could use a drink. She turns to see Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: No thanks.  15.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Seriously, not my night.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: How about a dance instead? Elaine takes the lead. Ryan happily tries to keep up. Jarrod and Elaine’s eyes meet. After a long beat, she sti her tongue out at him. Jarrod cracks a big smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a total scene. Models. Rockers. Power nerds. Drinkin Dancing. Smoking on the patio. The music plays loud. The L-shaped COUCH is packed, shoulder to shoulder. Ryan sits with a pouch of tobacco, rolling a cigarette on Candice’s fashion magazine. He’s pressed against Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: For real, I can’t stand cars.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: But don’t you need one out here?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Don’t believe that propaganda. He finishes rolling the butt with a lick across the paper

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I even bike to dates. If a lady don't like it, I don’t want her ass on my handlebars anyhow. A noticeably looser Jarrod approaches. Fresh drink in han

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Hey twinkle toes. How are you feeling? He sits down next to Elaine. Spills some on her sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Sorry, my bad.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: No worries. She gives him a frustrated look as he pats down her sleev  16. Ryan gets up and slides open the PATIO DOOR. Looks to Ela

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Puff on the patio? House rules.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: No thanks, trying to cut down.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Same here. How about you party boy?

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Sure. Why not? Jarrod follows Ryan out. Slides the door shut, leaving El by herself. Again. A DOUCHE BAG approaches her almost immediately. Cheesy gr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMOKE wafts through the air. Jarrod hands the butt to Rya There’s a handful of other SMOKERS on the patio with them Through the patio glass door: Elaine blows off the Douche storms into the guest bedroom, slamming the door behind h

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: That can’t be good. Jarrod sighs and heads back inside. Ryan smiles when... A strange blue LIGHT FLASHES across the sky. Ryan spins around, staring out at the city with a puzzled look. He turns to a SMOKING MODEL.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you see that? (Off her vacant look) It was the same color as your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine storms into the bedroom. Grabs the bathroom door handle. It’s locked. VOICES inside. Camera FLASHES reveal silhouette of entwined BODIES through the FROSTED GLASS. Jarrod enters the room. Shuts the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Elaine. Come on.  17.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: You come on. It’s like you've already decided for both of us.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Decided? Terry just sprung this California talk on me today.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: I’m not talking about California! The bathroom door swings OPEN. Denise sloppily emerges.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry. She quickly leaves the room. Elaine turns to Jarrod.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: I am trying to deal with this and you're getting wasted, leaving me with total strangers. Is a little consideration too much to ask? Jarrod runs his hands through his hair. Feeling guilty.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I... I’m just stressed-

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: And what about me Jarrod? My career, my body...

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: I am with you. Whatever you choose. Jarrod steps closer to Elaine. He takes her hands.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s just that... I don’t know... What kind of father can’t even pay his own rent? The bathroom door opens again. They do a double take as T walks out.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Hey. Just checking on... something. He leaves without any further embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Great. Is that what we have to look forward to?  18.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: No. Terry's always been that way.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: What about you? Ever been “that way?”

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Elaine. I am not Terry. Alright? She hesitates, slowly backing away from him.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: People change. Especially in L.A. With that she steps in the bathroom and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone crowds around the BIG SCREEN TV. The image is a FEED from a high tech TELESCOPE that Ryan is operating.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Wait! I think I got a live one! Ryan whips the telescope, panning across nearby apartment

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s see what’s behind door... number... one! TELESCOPE POV: In a neighbor’s WINDOW, where a MAN sits w a short haired WOMAN kneeling before him. Head in his lap The party bursts into LAUGHS and CHEERS. Candice sits in the kitchen. Sipping wine. Not amused.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have a weiner! Look at her go! TELESCOPE POV: The woman looks up from her knees to revea she’s not a woman at all. But another MAN. Ryan spits out his drink, collapses in laughter.

dialogues.speaker: PARTY GUY
dialogues.text: Yeah, boys! Show’em how it’s done! The doorbell RINGS.  19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The noise is audible. The door swings open. Candice stand there, looking up and down at Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Pardon me, ma’‘am, but we’ve received a few noise complaints.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: From who? The building’s half empty. Oliver lets out a polite laugh.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: I understand. But it’s two in the morning. So. If you don’t mind...

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Fine. Candice purses her lips in a KISS and shuts the door. Oliver is left shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry shuts the door on the last guests. Ryan and Denise still zoning on the couch. Ryan scuttles closer to her.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Uh, uh. I call couch.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Big enough for both of us, right? Denise shoves him onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: I like my space. Denise shoots Terry a ‘come hither’ glance. But he walks towards the windows and hits the CONTROL PANEL. MRRV! The state of the art WINDOW BLINDS automatically cl The last bit of light disappears from the living room. TITLE: DAY ONE - 3:50 A.M.  20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The strange LIGHT streaks through the closed blinds. Shadows dance over Elaine and Jarrod’s face. She stirs.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: How’s it morning already? He barely registers. Looks at the clock: 3:50 A.M.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: It’s not. It’s... jet lag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the light glowing through the slits of the window blinds, the building begins to SHAKE. Candice doesn’t even look up.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Earthquake? Terry rolls over.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Probably just a tremor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shirtless Ryan sits up from the shag. Even with the bli shut, it’s far brighter in here. Ryan nudges Denise awake

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Hey, check it out. She doesn’t care, turning over. But Ryan can’t let it go.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You ever seen anything like that? He clicks a control panel, OPENING the PATIO DOOR BLINDS. LIGHT washes over his face in an almost ecstatic haze.  21.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Turn off the lights... She slowly turns back to see the DISTENDED VEINS stretchi across his back like a spiderweb.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Raising her voice) Ryan... oh my God... He slides OPEN THE DOOR, flooding the room in radiance. Denise instinctively shields her eyes, backing away.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you- WHOMP. WHOMP. The FREQUENCY fills the air. A haunting mel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan steps outside. Soaked in sweat. Muscles twitching.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE NEIGHBORING BUILDING
dialogues.text: Other PEOPLE stand in the same hypnotized state, staring blackened pupils at

dialogues.speaker: AN INCANDESCENT SPHERE
dialogues.text: Hovering twenty feet in the air above Lincoln Blvd. It pu with energy, flowing out from its center. Beautiful. Tempting. Beckoning everyone near like a lucent SIREN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OLDER COUPLE exits their car, parked in the middle of road. They move towards the light, completely entranced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan presses against the railing, his body trembling. BAMPF! In the blink of eye, he’s gone. Vanished into thin air.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ryan!  22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrod bursts into the room.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: He’s gone! Turning to his left, Jarrod looks out through the open BALCONY DOOR. The brilliant light washes over him.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jarrod, no! Denise grabs Jarrod by the arm. Terry charges across the living room to see his friend, v bulging, eyes fully dilated.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What the hell’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Stop him- Jarrod tears away from Denise. The FREQUENCY drowns everything out as Jarrod moves forwa finally stepping outside, SIREN LIGHT FLARING OVER HIM. But he’s pulled back in by Terry.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What’s with you man? Jarrod pushes forward. Twice as strong. Terry gasps. It t everything he’s got to hold Jarrod back. Elaine emerges, rushing towards them.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Jarrod? But Denise wraps her arms around Elaine, holding her back

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Don't! Terry wrestles Jarrod down to the floor, into the shadows the upward arcing light.  23.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: What the... Elaine looks out to see the hint of

dialogues.speaker: OBJECTS FLYING UPWARDS THROUGH THE AIR
dialogues.text: Suddenly the lights die down. The tremors stop. Everything goes quiet. Jarrod stops writhing. Terry eases up. Catching his breat Elaine and Denise still hold each other. No one knows what to say.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (Annoyed) Are you guys fucking serious? Candice walks out to see: Terry lying over Jarrod. His veins bulging, covered in sw breathing like he just ran a marathon. CANDICE (CONT’D) (Shocked) Oh my God, what’s wrong with him? Elaine pushes Terry out of the way, jumping to Jarrod’s a His eyes are squeezed shut, jaw clenched.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: It’s okay. I’m right here. He finally eases up, looking back like he’s blind.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jarrod? Baby, can you see me? He shakes his head, everything is a blur. Still trying to catch his breath.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: What happened? Terry looks out the balcony door. It’s dark now. Hazy.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Please, please be-

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: I’m... I’m okay.  24. Jarrod sits up, shaking it off. Finally stares into Elain tortured face. She burrows into him, holding him tight.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Where’s Ryan? Terry steps out onto the patio.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: No! Don’t!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There’s a thick HAZE in the air. He can barely see the st lights below. Denise rushes out and pulls on Terry. Imploring.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Please! Come back inside!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Where'd that light come from? She grunts, forcing him back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise slams the door shut behind them. Closes the blinds

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You better start making some sense- Denise’s hand on Terry's chest. Candice glares at them.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Ryan... went out there. To the light. And... he just. Disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Somebody's had a little too much to drink.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Then explain what happened to him. Jarrod looks up, still disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Jarrod, man, what did you see?  25. Jarrod stands up, gathering his thoughts. He speaks softl a measured and haunted tone.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: It was... like I was flying. Towards this shimmering light.... But I'd never seen the color before. He looks away from Elaine’s gaze.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was beautiful. ROAR! An ungodly growl ECHOES from the base of the buildi Everyone is shocked. Standing still for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What in the hell was that? Terry walks to the windows. Looks through a crack in the blinds. Can't see anything. Turns to the TELESCOPE.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (To Jarrod) Give me a hand. Jarrod helps Terry position the telescope through the cor crack in the blinds.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Wait, stop for-

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: No, you stop! Nothing makes any sense. We have to know what’s what. Denise is rattled, but she stops protesting. Candice DIALS 911 on her blackberry. Holds the phone to h ears, listening to it ring. Over and over again. Terry changes the input on the TV, broadcasting the Telescope’s LIVE FEED onto the Big Screen. Elaine moves behind Jarrod, puts an arm on his shoulder. looks into her eyes, nodding. He mans the Telescope. TELESCOPE POV: Panning across the skyline - It’s still ha making it hard to see anyone or anything outside. Everyone watches in rapt silence, not sure what to expect  26. TELESCOPE POV: SMOKE PLUMES on the horizon. Eerily calm. There are several ABANDONED CARS in the middle of the Lin Blvd. Then. A HULKING SHADOW tears through the intersecti Jarrod pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: There’s something down there. On the street... Terry shakes his head. Still skeptical, he gets behind th telescope, panning around.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I don’t see anything. TELESCOPE POV: He pans up to the neighboring ROOFTOP wher group of RESIDENTS point and look off in the other direct

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait, there’s people... Turns back to the group. Points at the neighboring buildi

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: On the roof.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: What are they doing? Terry struggles with the Telescope. Scanning over.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Can’t tell. But we should check it out. Steps away from the telescope.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go to the roof. His words hang there for a moment. Jarrod looks down. No one likes the idea, especially Denise.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, Jarrod. Jarrod hesitates. Looks to Elaine then Terry.  27.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay. Terry nods, walks off to the MASTER BEDROOM.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you’re all just ignoring me... Denise begins CRYING. Elaine comforts her.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Jarrod, you can’t go out there.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: I can’t let him go alone. Terry returns holding a GLOCK HANDGUN, making Elaine nerv

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: A gun?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Just to be safe. Elaine throws up her arms.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: (Dismissive) Really? Terry ignores her. Candice shakes her head. Dials 911 aga Jarrod grabs Denise’s CAMERA off the counter. Looks throu the zoom lens. His gears are turning.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (To Jarrod) Let's go. Jarrod looks to Elaine. Tears in her eyes. He holds her f in his hands. She hesitates, then kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Hurry back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door slowly opens. Terry inches out. Gun drawn. Jarrod follows. Camera around his neck. Everything is quiet. They relax somewhat.  28.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Stairs are this way. They head down the hall. Slowly creeping around the corner. Still not a sound. RUFF! Terry spins around, gun raised to see: An ELDERLY MAN stands in his doorway, holding his SMALL D

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY MAN
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa! Terry lowers the gun.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Walt. God damn. Scared the hell out of me man. It’s Terry’s neighbor WALT and his BARKING dog MALCOLM.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: What’s going on? Did you hear that noise? Is it Al Qaeda?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: We're going to check it out-

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Malcolm’s been going crazy and I-

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Listen just stay inside and keep your blinds shut. We’1l be back, okay? Walt nods, closes the door. INT. NORTH STAIRWELL —- DAWN Terry leads the way up the fluorescent lit steps. Jarrod looks over his shoulder, feeling edgy. They reach the top of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Wait up. They stop beside the DOOR to the ROOF.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s the plan?  29. Terry adjusts his grip on the gun. Nerves catching up to

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I'll go first. Watch my back. Jarrod nods. An understanding passes between them. Terry takes a deep breath. Opens the DOOR. LIGHT FLOODS OVER TERRY. But it’s just the SUNRISE.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They emerge onto the industrial rooftop, facing WEST. The can see all the way to the OCEAN past the Marina. Jarrod moves forward, aims the CAMERA towards the coast. Zooms in on the clear blue water. Snaps off a quick shot.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Looks calm... SLAM! The door shuts behind them. Terry grabs the handle. It’s locked.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Damn it Jarrod!?

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: You never told me to hold it open.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I thought it was common sense!

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I- WHOMP. WHOMP. The FREQUENCY bellows through the air.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Get down! They duck down.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: What now?  30. Terry motions with his head, the crouch forward towards t stairwell to the HELIPAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candice paces back and forth. Phone attached to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Just keeps ringing. Elaine nods, looking down at her iPhone - dialing her MOM with similar results. She turns on the TV. It displays th default “Acquiring Signal” graphic. Satellite interferenc

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Perfect. Denise is curled up on the couch, searching on her iPhone

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: I've looked everywhere online. No news since 4 AM.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: What about Facebook, Twitter?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: A few people... All asking the same questions.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Someone has to know about this. Elaine stands before the Telescope. Takes a deep breath. TELESCOPE POV: She passes over a neighborhood in the distance. Hundreds of flailing SHADOWS rise from the grou

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my God... Shocked, she turns and darts towards the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Jarrod slowly moving up the last steps.  31. On the neighboring building’s ROOFTOP they can see FIVE RESIDENTS staring off at the city in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the helipad. Following the neighbors’ gazes to see: The HAZE is clearing, offering a sprawling view of the skyline stretching out before them. With mouths agape, they see some forty blocks away: TINY SPECKS RISE UP into the air - spiralling upwards int the CLOUDS above. Then breaking forth from the cloud cover, half the distan away, they see: A SHIP. MASSIVE. OTHERWORLDLY. A NIGHTMARE.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What. The. Fuck. A quarter mile wide. Like a single cell organism on an ep scale. It hovers in the air with pure, unadulterated mena Beyond that even more SHIPS become visible. DOZENS of the loom over the entire city. WHOMP. WHOMP. The FREQUENCY sounds. From the bottom of th nearest SHIP the INCANDESCENT SPHERE lowers, softly drift towards the ground before emitting the SIREN LIGHT. Jarrod shields his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Don’t look at it man! Terry ignores him, staring out at the horrible spectacle.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Damn it Terry!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: That shit’s over a mile away. Jarrod unblocks his eyes to see Terry’s right. He looks o at the ship. Suddenly they see a SWARM rising through the air. Jarrod raises the camera to his eyes. Zooms in. Focuses.  32. IT’S PEOPLE. Everyone in a three block radius of the SIREN is sucked i the ship by a vacuum force.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That what I think it is?!

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: My God... They stand there is stunned silence, watching the human population being vacuumed off the face of the Earth. When it’s done a HAZE of DEBRIS fills the air under the S Jarrod scans the ship with the ZOOM lens, clicking away. Stops. Sees something. Lowers the lens.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What? Jarrod begins backing away.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Run.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JUST RUN
dialogues.text: Jarrod and Terry tear ass across the Helipad. In the SKY ABOVE: DOZENS of DRAGON-LIKE SHIPS, around the size of fighter j begin launching off the MOTHERSHIP. They are the HYDRA. One HYDRA heads directly towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Jarrod jump down the steps, adrenaline on overdrive.  33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stumble towards the locked door. Working together, t try to pull it open. No dice.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Back up, back up! Terry raises his gun. Aims at the lock. BOOM! BOOM! Jarrod tears at the handle. But it doesn’t budge.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Damn it! The HYDRA ship rounds the building, it’s surface is a horrific meld of living tissue and metallic structuring. makes quick work of the NEIGHBORS of the adjacent rooftop BOOM! Terry shoots the lock again. Still won’t open. A bright SIREN SPOTLIGHT hits them. They shield their eye the HYDRA lowers down towards their roof. In a last gasp, they both pull frantically at the door. Giving it all they got. Nothing. Jarrod sinks to the grou Terry and Jarrod share a look. Preparing for the end. CREAK. The door swings opens. ELAINE stands before them. She looks into the SPOTLIGHT of the oncoming HYDRA. Veins immediately bulge across her body. She steps towards it.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! He jumps to his feet, pulling her away as Terry slams the door shut behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They burst through the front door. A shaking Jarrod lays Elaine down. She writhes in his arms, slowly coming back consciousness. Denise rushes to help. Holding Elaine’s head up. Terry runs to the freezer, pulls out a bag of ice. Jarrod applies it to Elaine’s forehead. His hands tremble.  34.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: (Clenched jaw) Come on baby... She looks up. Her pupils slowly return to normal size. Co comes back to her cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: My head feels like it’s on fire.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: (Breathing deeply) I know. It’1ll pass. I promise. She grabs hold of her stomach. Jarrod looks down and plac his hand over hers. Her eyes widen as she stares at his A

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: You looked again? Jarrod sees the VEINS on his arms are BULGING as well.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But how...? Jarrod doesn’t know what to say. An oblivious Denise lets out a huge sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: What happened up there?! No one answers. Terry rubs his nose anxiously. Jarrod finally hands the CAMERA over to Denise.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: See for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine sits huddled next to Jarrod as Candice and Denise scrub through the PHOTOS on her CAMERA’S LCD DISPLAY. Terry paces back and forth. Eyes determined.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Oh my God... They stare at a close up of a WOMAN flying through the ai  35.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: All of those people... The next photo shows the SHIP swallowing entire columns o humans. Elaine stares at it hard.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do they do with them?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I’m not looking to find out. Candice takes the camera from Denise. Begins scrolling through the photos.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: I can’t believe... I mean, how?

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Once you look... it grabs hold. Like it...

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Controls you. Elaine and Jarrod lock eyes. Putting things together.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who wouldn’t stare at something so beautiful? Then... Terry doesn’t like the sound of it.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s kind of genius actually.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, fucking brilliant. Everyone turns to stare at Terry. His eyes wide. Perspiri

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: At least I’m trying to piece it together.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Who cares? We need to worry about saving ourselves. Jarrod stands up, moving between them.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: So what are we going to do?  36.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Terry heads for the front door.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I got an idea.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Check on my neighbor Walt.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Don’t sweat it, I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Terry-—

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I can handle it. Opens the door slowly.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just be cool. And stay quiet. Terry leaves. And it is quiet for a moment. Elaine sighs and moves towards the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine puts on her sweater. Her hands rest on her stomach a moment. Concern on her face. She heads to the door. She stops. BZZZ. BZ2ZZ. Elaine's eyes widen. She pulls her iPhone out of her pock The display reads MOM. She picks up.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Mom? A FEMALE VOICE answers. Bad connection. Cutting in and ou  37.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (hysterical) Elaine! Elaine is overwhelmed with joy.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: (whispering) Yeah mom. It’s me. Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I saw them... I saw. Everybody's gone! They’re all gone!

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Mom, please listen to me, you have to stay inside!

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I am inside. WHOMP. WHOMP. The frequency begins to fade in over the ph

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Mom!!! Elaine hears her mother’s BLOOD CURDLING SCREAM!

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mom? Elaine pulls the phone away from her ear. After a moment, the frequency begins to fade. Elaine is shaking. She puts her ear to the phone and list It’s not disconnected. Just nobody on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (louder) Mom? Silence.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (screaming) Mom! She throws her phone against the wall in anger. Jarrod storms into the room, rushing over to her.  38.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Baby, you have to quiet down- She pushes him away. Emotions overwhelming her.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: They took my mother! Jarrod stares into her eyes. Steps towards her again.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: I'm sorry-

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: They took her... She walks away. Inconsolable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry stands outside of Walt’s FRONT DOOR. Quietly KNOCKS

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (Whispers) Walt... Yo Walt, open up! No answer... He KNOCKS. A little louder this time. Nothin Looks at the DOORBELL. Thinks about pressing it. Almost d But on second thought he tries the HANDLE. IT’S UNLOCKED. INT. WALT’S APARTMENT - FOYER - DAY Terry slowly steps inside. There’s an eerie WHISTLING drifting in from the living ro

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Walt? No answer. Terry takes out his gun. Slowly moves into the: INT. WALT’S APARTMENT - KITCHEN - DAY It’s a corner unit with an open layout. From here, he can the entire living room.  39.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Anybody here? The PATIO DOOR is cracked open. The whistling is nothing than a busted wind chime. He sighs. Goes to the kitchen counter. Checks the key rac Finds a MERCEDES key. Pockets it.

dialogues.speaker: WALT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (Whispered) You at least gonna ask? A stunned Terry looks to see Walt hiding behind the count with his WHIMPERING dog Malcolm.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Jesus! Man, don’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Listen, I got a plan but I need to borrow your wheels. Walt doesn’t seem too sure.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: I don’t know- VROOSH! A strange noise echoes from OUTSIDE. RUFF! RUFF! Malcolm barks out.

dialogues.speaker: WALT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Quiet boy!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Through the windows: something RISES UP OUTSIDE the build THE HYDRA SHIP. Humming in the air above the patio.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Walt pulls Terry down behind the counter as the lights wa over the room.  40.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: SOMETHING around the size of a phone booth detaches from ship. Hovers onto the patio. Pulsing with ENERGY. The patio door slides open.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Walt, with his hands clamped around Malcolm’s mouth looks around the corner. Terry stays deathly still. Grips his gun tightly.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: IT hovers past the furniture. Completely stealth.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Terry looks at Walt and his dog, then the front door. Psyching himself up. But everything is quiet. For a long stretch. Walt turns back to Terry.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: (Whispers) I think it’s gone- GRRR! Malcolm growls. Jumps from Walt’s arms and runs aro the counter.

dialogues.speaker: WALT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Malcolm! He dives after the dog. Terry turns to see Walt’s body RIPPED away.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: No! Walt! Terry rises to his feet to see: Walt violently pulled through the air - across the room i THE DRONE - 7 feet tall - a tentacled mass of death.  41. It OPENS - like a bio-mech Venus fly trap - swallowing Wa and his down inside its revolting PUPAS SAC. Terry stares wide eyed at WALT, still alive inside the translucent monster’s WOMB.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh shit! Terry unloads on it. The Drone recoils. SIREN LIGHT floods Terry as he turns and sprints, blindly firing over his shoulder. He bolts out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise walks over to the table where Candice sits alone, smoking a long, skinny CIGARETTE.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Did you think you two were going to live happily ever after?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: What? Turns the Camera’s DISPLAY towards Denise. It shows a PHO of Denise and Terry in a compromising position.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Please. You're just the weekend party. Candice laughs out smoke. Ashes her butt. MUFFLED GUN SHOTS ring out. Coming down the hall. Jarrod and Elaine hurry into the room.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Did you hear that? Terry explodes through the front door.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: We gotta get out of here. Now!

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: We're leaving. Getting on my boat and getting the hell out of here.  42.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Those things are in the Goddamn building. Came right through the patio door... He trails off... Lets out a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Point is, we’re no safer here than anywhere else.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Then let’s just go!

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Hold on a second. Am I the only one who saw those photos? That’s going on right outside. Right now. They’re everywhere-

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: No. Not everywhere. (Sighs) Not over the water. Elaine feels the slight sting of betrayal. Getting worked

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: It didn’t take very long for them to find you on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: It’s a two minute drive.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: We have no idea what they’re capable of.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Listen Elaine, I know you’re scared. We’re all scared. But I’m not gonna put my head in the sand and hope this goes away. Jarrod steps towards Terry.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Take it easy man.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: There’s nothing easy about this!  43. MRRV! A LOUD CLICK. Followed by a MOTORIZED HUM. LIGHT begins to flood the room. THE BLINDS ARE OPENING.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: What the-

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: The timer! Terry and Candice dash to the far side of the room toward the CONTROL PANEL.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everybody hide! Jarrod pulls Elaine down behind the KITCHEN ISLAND. Denise SCREAMS, rolling onto the floor beneath the couch. THE BLINDS ARE COMPLETELY OPEN. Terry pushes Candice behind the FIREPLACE WALL.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay still! As Terry makes for the Control Panel on the wall... SOMETHING turns the corner of the building. A HYDRA.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Damn! Terry doubles back behind the fireplace. He stands face to face with Candice. She gives him a ster glance before they both shut their eyes tight. The SIREN LIGHT BEAMS IN, scanning the condo, raking acro the walls, accompanied by an EERIE HUM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrod and Elaine are huddled behind the island, covered shadow. Watching the light move towards the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise cowers on the floor. Light dances over and around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrod and Elaine hold each other as the light vanishes. The HYDRA’s hum fades off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Candice crack open their eyes and look around. He peaks around the corner to see the now full DRONE dock back onto HYDRA as it flies up over the roof. He darts to the control panel, mashing the button. MRRV. The blinds close. Darkness envelops the penthouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrod and Elaine stand up as Terry approaches.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You still want to stay?

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: I don’t want any of this. But, it didn’t see us... if we stay quiet- Terry can’t believe what he’s hearing.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Those things aren’t blowing up buildings. They’re going after people. Plain and simple. (turns to Jarrod) Further we get away from all this, the safer we are.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: (to Elaine) He’s right.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Jarrod...

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: If we get to the boat, we have a chance.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Now. But-  45.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: We have to try.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Gather your stuff. Pull together water and food. Let’s do this. Terry pockets the BOAT KEY, and pulls out his GUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry leads the crew out the door. Jarrod takes the rear they hustle towards the:

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR BANK
dialogues.text: Terry slams the down button. They wait nervously. The building MOANS and CRACKLES. A MUFFLED SCREAM echoes in the distance. Terry hits the button repeatedly. DING. The doors open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew files in. Terry hits the button labeled Pl. The elevator descends. All eyes fixated on the floor disp A faint BOOM is heard. The elevator RATTLES. Lights FLICK Jarrod pulls Elaine closer. The floor display reads: 5... 4... 3... Terry readies himself. Aims at the door. DING. Display reads: Pl. The doors open. Silence. Nothing but row after row of luxury cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry leads the group towards his silver convertible Ferr  46.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: The sooner I get there, the sooner that boat is ready to go. Terry tosses WALT’S KEYS to Jarrod. Candice intercepts th

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: (to Elaine and Jarrod) Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Driving. I know the way. (points to Denise) You can take the slut. Denise frowns. Candice gives Terry a cold, knowing stare.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Candice-

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: (to Elaine and Jarrod) Come on. Terry watches Candice lead them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry hops the door into the driver's seat. Denise gets i

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Terry. I’m sorry. I- Terry starts the engine, unleashing a guttural GROWL. He turns to stare coldly at Denise. Puts it into reverse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari zips backward, out of the parking spot. Terry pulls up to meet Candice behind the wheel of the Mercedes. Jarrod rides shotgun. Elaine in back.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (Leaning out the window) Alright. Take it nice and slow until the second gate. When that opens. We tear ass to the dock.  47.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Got it. Candice looks to Denise then back to Terry. He pulls away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candice, Jarrod and Elaine watch intently, following the Ferrari through the FIRST SECURITY GATE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn the corner to the next level. Passing through t SECOND SECURITY GATE. Amongst the empty cars, a COUPLE loads their SUV. In thei 40s, the HUSBAND and WIFE throw supplies in the back. Terry drives right on by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrod looks at the couple. Then back to Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: (to Candice) Slow down a bit. Candice gives an annoyed look, but complies. Jarrod rolls down the window and leans his head out.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you guys okay? The Husband hesitates, exchanges a look with his Wife.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you need-

dialogues.speaker: HUSBAND
dialogues.text: Just go. We’re fine.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: (to Husband) But maybe-

dialogues.speaker: HUSBAND
dialogues.text: (to Wife) Enough! Alright? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: HUSBAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (turns to Jarrod) I said we're fine! Jarrod eases back. Rolls up his window. Candice pulls awa In the side view mirror, the Wife stare back at Jarrod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari approaches the THIRD SECURITY GATE. Beyond the gate is the VALET OVERHANG that leads to the C DE SAC and out to Lincoln Boulevard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry looks back to see the Mercedes pull up behind him. takes a deep breath. Looks to Denise.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Here we go. Terry hits the GARAGE DOOR OPENER. Revs the engine. The gate squeaks and rattles open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari launches past the gate, through the Valet overhang, and towards the end of the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCH
dialogues.text: The FERRARI IS SMASHED FROM ABOVE... Crumpled like a tin can by a HULKING MASS... Terry is THROWN from the car, smacking onto the asphalt. Above him stands:

dialogues.speaker: THE TANKER
dialogues.text: A twenty foot tall BIO-MECHANICAL BEAST. Walking on all fours, it GRINDS the Ferrari into the ground with its CLA unleashing a monstrous ROAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candice, Jarrod and Elaine SCREAM in horror.  49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry looks up with wide eyes. He scampers to his feet. The Tanker REARS UP ON ITS HIND LEGS. Enormous. Terrifyin The Ferrari wreckage shakes off its claw, crashing to the ground to reveal: DENISE’S MANGLED BODY strewn across its knuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candice can’t believe her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry limps as fast as he can towards the garage. The Tanker turns. Clenches its RIGHT CLAW. Terry hobbles under the OVERHANG, steps from the gate. The Tanker’s CLAW SWEEPS after him. IT MISSES. Terry falls to the ground. It can’t reach.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch! Lying on his side, Terry pulls the gun from his jeans. He UNLOADS on it. Firing ROUND after ROUND. But the Tanke just keeps coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group watches with pure dread. Jarrod opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Come on man! Get in! The Tanker’s CLAW sweeps again and again. Getting closer time. Jarrod swallows. Jumps out after Terry.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Jarrod!!!  50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry gets up and limps towards Jarrod. Arms outstretched

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: I got you! They lock arms. Terry’s never looked so thankful or afrai The Tanker lunges into the over hang. Everything shakes. TENDRILS LAUNCH from the Tanker’s CLAW, ENSNARING TERRY. Jarrod is knocked to the ground as the tendrils wrap arou Terry's body, dripping an iridescent black OIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candice and Elaine SCREAM at the top of their lungs. Terry is RIPPED BACKWARDS, slamming into the TANKER’S CLA His body SNAPS, SWALLOWED through an ORIFICE in its PALM.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: (screaming) No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrod is devastated, watching the beast in stunned horro

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: (Through the window) Jarrod! Get your ass in here! He snaps out of it as: The TENDRILS LASH OUT AGAIN. Just short of his foot. He scrambles back into the Merced INT. MERCEDES —- CONTINUOUS The TENDRILS whip around again, slamming down on the hood with a CRUNCH!

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Back up! Candice throws the car into REVERSE and slams the gas ped  51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mercedes screeches backwards. Candice turns and pops the car back into DRIVE, skidding halt in front of the second gate. They zoom past the COUPLE, running back from the entrance

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: (Yells out the window) Get back inside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candice mashes the button. The gate slowly OPENS.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Come on, you piece of shit! AN OTHERWORLDLY HUM reverberates through the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wife looks over her shoulder at the garage ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HUMMING GROWS LOUDER. Drowning out everything. On the other side of the gate: A BRIGHT LIGHT appears around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Get down! Doubled over in the driver’s seat, Candice throws it back into reverse and hits the gas. The Mercedes speeds violently back from the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SAVAGE looking DRONE turns the corner. BIGGER and BULKI than the others and twice as mean. ITS SIREN LIGHT floods over the Couple. The Husband pushes his Wife to safety.  52.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: Colin, no! The Husband is YANKED BACK through the air, sucked across garage and into the Drone’s MASSIVE PUPAS SAC. The Wife SCREAMS! Turns and runs behind the row of cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candice steers blindly. Weaves through the garage. SLAM! The car collides with a pillar. Air bags deploy. Jarrod pushes the air bag out of his face.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Elaine! In the back seat, Elaine shakes the cobwebs out her head.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: I'm alright. Candice fumbles with her seat belt. Jumps out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Come on, let’s go! Jarrod and Elaine dash out of the Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candice reaches an EXIT DOOR. LOCKED. She bangs hard.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Somebody! Please! Jarrod and Elaine catch up. Jarrod throws his weight at t door. No luck. Elaine looks for another way to go. But they’re cornered, the DRONE coming straight for them. A SHRIEK ECHOES through the garage.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh god, help me! They all turn to see... The Wife scampering towards them. She staggers into Elain arms, weeping.  53.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please. Please. You. Have. To... The HUM drowns her out. The DRONE bears down on them. Jarrod shields Elaine. Candice and the Wife cower. Eyes s The Drone is moving fast. LIGHTS BLARING. Jarrod steels himself. Slowly, he opens his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: CRUSHING IT AGAINST A PILLAR.
dialogues.text: ITS SIREN LIGHTS FADE. It releases a miserable MOAN. A de rattle. Elaine open her eyes, looking at the Escalade in disbelie OLIVER jumps out of the driver’s door. Looks them over. S Jarrod: shaking, veins bulging, coming off being entrance

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: You alright? Everyone is speechless. Elaine notices Jarrod’s condition She grabs his arm. Worry on her face.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: I’m okay. Candice stares at the Drone. Its torn torso gushes a blac bio-mech oil mixed with human blood. The Wife’s eyes bulge. Shaking in horror at the gruesome sight of the HUSBAND'S twisted body amongst the alien carnage. Oliver pulls a KEY RING from his belt. Unlocks the Exit D Candice moves through. Jarrod pulls Elaine by the hand. Elaine stops in the doorway. Looking sympathetically to t Wife, then to Oliver. Oliver puts his arm around the Wife.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Miss, we have to go- A GROAN. The Husband stirs to life.  54.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: He’s alive! She pushes past Oliver to help her husband to his knees. Candice, Jarrod, and Elaine watch from the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh thank God! Oliver helps the two of them to their feet.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Come on, let’s go. SLURP! A GLOWING TENDRIL envelops the HUSBAND'S HEAD, sea through his flesh.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: No! She pulls at her husband’s arms as his BRAIN is RIPPED OU His lifeless remains fall before her feet. The tendril takes the brain and retreats into the Drone’s womb. Almost instantly it SCREAMS, violently lashing back life. Limbs cracking into place as it begins REBUILDING itself back to its original size and strength. The Drone pushes the SUV back off it. Gaining strength. Oliver instinctively yanks the Wife back. Pulls her through the door and SLAMS it shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candice, Jarrod and Elaine barrel up the stairs, stopping the last landing. The final flight of stairs leads UP and to the POOL AREA.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Did you see that? It ripped his God damn brain out! Oliver and the Wife join them. Candice looks away.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Make for the back door. Everyone nods. The Wife quietly shakes her head.  55. They gather themselves and run up the stairs to the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top of the stairs. The coast is clear. Candice leads them around the fireplace. She suddenly stops. Frozen in terror, they slowly look to the right. In the rear plaza of the adjacent REGATTA BUILDING... A massive figure lurks behind the trees. It stops moving. And turns slowly towards the group. THE TANKER TOWERS OVER THEM, glaring menacingly. A long, terrifying pause as they stare each other down.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Run! Candice leads as the group tears ass around the patio. The Tanker REARS UP on its hind legs, bellowing an awful CRY before smashing down onto all fours and giving chase. The Wife stumbles. Oliver pulls her up.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: You can make it!

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: I can’t! The Tanker gallops onto to the pool deck, his claw splash the water. The Wife looks back. Terrified. Oliver yanks her arm.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Come on! The Tanker spots the Wife. Extends its CLAW. THE TENDRILS launch, ensnaring her. She screams as the TENDRILS RIP her back through the air.  56. Her body SMASHES through the GLASS fence surrounding the pool, before she’s slurped into the Tanker’s palm ORIFICE Oliver turns and runs. Candice leads the group through a SUNKEN CONCRETE WALKWAY eight feet below the pool area. The BACK DOORWAY is up ahead. Almost there. CRASH! The TANKER BARRELS over the group running on the sunken walkway below. Its limbs SMASH all around them, ba missing each time. The Tanker COLLIDES into the adjacent fencing, falling ov The group reaches the straightaway to the back door. ROAR! Everyone looks to the LEFT. A SECOND TANKER emerges from the side of the building. Everyone doubles their speed. Fight or flight kicking in. Candice slams into the BACK DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: It’s locked!

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: No! The second Tanker charges them. Oliver reaches the door. Everything shakes as the Tanker draws closer. Oliver fumbles with his MULTIPLE KEY FOBS. He swipes one across the security panel. BEEP. Oliver pulls on the door. LOCKED. The tanker is 10 yards away. Oliver swipes another FOB. No dice.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Open the fucking door- Oliver throws his shoulder into it. Again and again. Jarrod joins Oliver. Both of them lunging at the door, breaking it open.  57. They explode through, spilling out onto the ground.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Hurry! Everyone piles through after them. Oliver SLAMS it shut. BOOM! The whole building shakes as the Tanker rams it. They fall to the floor. Stunned and scared. The TENDRILS slam against the glass windows on the door. Leaving a black oily trails on the glass. Quickly backing away, the group heads towards the elevato

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door swings open. Everyone rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Come on, quickly, quickly. Oliver carefully closes the door. Locks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candice crashes on the couch. Elaine catches her breath. Oliver swiftly moves through the condo. Checks all the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrod splashes water on his face. But his tears continue fall. He looks up in the mirror to see Elaine behind him.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: I can’t believe he’s gone... Elaine wraps her arms around him. Trying to comfort him.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry... Her hands go the still bubbling veins on his arms. Jarrod looks down as well.  58.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When I saw that light, I couldn't stand up for five minutes. She looks into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How are you doing this? He looks away. Unsure of what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit to the bathroom, arm in arm, to see Candice bawling. They join her on the couch. Hanging their heads. Oliver is on the Telescope. Pans quickly. Erratic.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: (Under his breath) Lord all mighty. TELESCOPE POV: Drones roam the city. Tankers storm buildi Chasing stragglers through the streets. A ground strike. clean up crew. Mother Ships loom on the horizon. Oliver snaps around. Sees everyone in emotional shock. Decides he shouldn't share this information. He scans the room. Charges towards a BOOKSHELF. Motions t Jarrod.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey! Jarrod tilts his head up, revealing tear filled eyes.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Enough, alright. Get over here and help me with this. Jarrod looks to Elaine. Wipes his tears. He gets up and grabs one end of the shelf.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In front of the door. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two muscle the bookshelf to the FRONT DOOR. A barrica  59.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Better than nothing, right?

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: If you say so. Oliver roughly grabs Jarrod, by his shirt. Pure convictio his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: (Harshly) What are you doing? Huh? Like it or not, this is happening. (looks to the girls) You got to be strong. Jarrod straightens his spine. Finally able to stare back. Oliver nods. But never breaks eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrod and Oliver walk back towards the couch.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Is everybody alright? The weeping Candice looks at him like he’s an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you hurt? She finally shakes her head. Oliver looks to Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: I’m okay. Jarrod sits next to her, taking her hand. Tries to be sto Oliver sits across from them. Takes off his uniform jacke His dress shirt opens. A GOLD CROSS dangles from his neck

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks again. You really saved our asses. Jarrod nods in approval. Candice dries her tears. Choking back sobs.  60.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Yeah... thanks... thank you. Oliver doesn’t respond. Just locks eyes with her in an intense gaze that she slowly shrinks away from.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: (Sighing) We stay here. Safest place I can think of.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: And? We wait.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: For help. We stay quiet, keep watch, and pray someone comes. Jarrod looks to Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: He’s right. Somebody has to... This can’t go on forever, right? They sit in silence. Not wanting to contemplate the answe Candice lights a cigarette. She blows the smoke forward. Tears still are running down her face. Elaine is disgusted. She gets up. Heads for the Guest bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Sweetie, it’s best if we stay together.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: I can’t- the smoke-

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Given the circumstances, I think a smoke is more than reasonable.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: I never said-  61.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: From the moment you stepped foot in here, you've been a total drag-

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: And you've been a total bitch! Jarrod puts his arm around Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Baby, it’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Why don’t you leave then?

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Stop it Candice.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with you people?

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: I’m pregnant, alright? Candice exhales. Realization hitting her.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Between all of... the stress... and... I just thought smoke is the last thing...

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: I know. It’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: I... never even got to tell my mom. Oliver watches them intently. Visibly moved. A puff of sm passes his face. He turns to see Candice taking another d

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Put out the cigarette! Rattled, Candice stamps her smoke out in a decorative bow

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (To Elaine) You okay dear? Elaine slowly nods.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on Boss. Let the girls sleep. We'll keep watch.  62.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Both of us?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: If they try that light stuff, we got each other’s back.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: (to Elaine) Try to get some rest. I'll be right over there. Elaine nods. Lays down. Jarrod kisses her softly. He walks to the telescope with Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: (To herself) I fucking hate L.A. Elaine looks across the couch to a tear stained Candice. Elaine sighs and takes a blanket over to her.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry... I didn’t know-

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: It’s okay. I didn’t really either. They share a smile. Then lie down on opposite ends of the couch. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit in darkness. Not wanting to attract attention. Oliver scans with the telescope. Jarrod is behind him, leaning on the fire place wall. He' penciling on a SKETCH PAD in his lap. They speak in hushed voices.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: It’s quiet now. Oliver is still glued to the telescope.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe the worst is over.  63. TELESCOPE POV: Nothing stirs on the streets. Faint glows hidden by the clouds in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Maybe not. He turns the pad, looking at it from another angle. It’s surreal picture of the SIREN LIGHT. Haunting. Beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you think those things are?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Does it even matter?

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Probably not. (sighs) It doesn’t even seem real.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Well, it is real. Oliver turns to Jarrod, sizing him up.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
