dialogues.text: And you better man up. (he looks to Elaine) For her. (he looks to Jarrod) For your baby. Jarrod stops drawing, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: We don’t even know if, you know-

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: What are you blind? She’s decided. Jarrod glances over towards Elaine’s sleeping figure.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Motions to the window) All this makes it even more important. Not gonna be many of us left. The words just hang there for a moment. Too true.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s the problem, with... kids like you.  64.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: You don’t know me.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: You got everything... and you just want to throw it all away. (looks at Jarrod) Too selfish to grow up. Jarrod almost says something but stops. Lets it sink in. Then goes back to drawing. Head down.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: What about you? You got kids? Oliver doesn’t answer for a moment. A change comes over h

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: (Pained) I did. Wife too. His looks down to the RING on his left hand.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My world ended a long time ago. Jarrod stops sketching. Starting to understand Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: I... I’m sorry... Oliver turns back to the telescope. Resuming his duty. FADE TO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises over the water, illuminating the wasted cit scape of Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Try looking to the left...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver pulls his sleep deprived eyes away from the Telesc  65.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Nothing. Candice emerges from the kitchen, handing them each an ESPRESSO.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: You sure? He nods. Oliver accepts his with a smile, the irony of the moment lost on him.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Gracias. He watches Candice walk over to the

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Elaine sits on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Double espresso? Elaine stares at her for a moment. CANDICE (CONT’D) Just kidding. They share a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: God forbid you ever get knocked up.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: (Nods with a smile) I know. Everything I love is off limits. She takes a sip. Slowly realizing she probably never will

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrod stands in the doorway. Over Terry's bed is a PAINTING of an angelic face on a bl background. Jarrod stares at it. Tears welling in his eye  66. Candice enters behind him. They exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: This was the first one I ever sold. Jarrod smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was supposed to be a gift but he insisted on paying for it. Candice nods knowingly. Puts her hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: It was his favorite, you know. Jarrod chokes up a little. Looks her in the eyes. CANDICE (CONT’D) Terry could be such an asshole. But I loved him. Everyone did. They stand there for a moment. Looking at Jarrod’s painti WHOMP. WHOMP. They turn, ducking down as a HYDRA whooshes past the building. Holding their breath. Watching intently. And then.. The HYDRA moves on. The sound of the FREQUENCY fades away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME LAPSE: The group moves positions across the condo. F the couch - to the telescope - the kitchen - bathrooms. Bored. Tired. The fight literally draining from their bod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine and Candice are splayed across the couch. Jarrod lays across two chairs. Oliver sleeps on a seat be the Telescope. It’s completely silent. Almost peaceful. Then... A FAINT BOOM is heard in the distance.  67. The building RATTLES a bit. They wake with a start. Jarrod and Oliver look around, listening. MORE EXPLOSIONS sound off in the night.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Take a look! Oliver puts his eye to the telescope.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: I don’t see anything... Jarrod picks up the remote to turn on the TV. Elaine sits up from the couch.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: I want to see what’s out there. Oliver looks up.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: No. It’s too bright. Can’t risk it. Jarrod looks to Oliver then Elaine. Puts down the remote. Satisfied Oliver returns his eye to the Telescope. TELESCOPE POV: Only FIRE and SMOKE followed by bursts of light on the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There!

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: What’s happening?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Somebody's fighting back. They all listen to the combat. The EXPLOSIONS die down. The sound of one side losing. Ba Jarrod looks at Elaine. Concern growing on his face. A few last BOOMS are extinguished, giving way to...  68. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrod turns the faucet. No water comes out. He tries the toilet. Nothing. Frustrated, he looks into the mirror. Stubble over grown. Bags under his eyes. His stare grows focused. Determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone assumes their positions. Oliver at the telescope Candice on the couch. Elaine by the fireplace. Only Jarrod paces back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Why don’t you take a seat. Relax. Jarrod shakes his head. Oliver sighs.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright. I’1l bite. What’s your plan Boss? I know you’re dying to tell me.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: I don’t have a plan-

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Really? Nothing you want to say? Jarrod looks over at Candice and Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Look. We’re on a marina for Christ’s sake.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: I’ve noticed.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: So there are hundreds of boats just across the street.  69.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Remind me how that worked out last time.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: We go on foot. Quietly.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: And search every boat until we find a key? That’s great plan Jarrod. Elaine stands up. Not liking where this is going.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you'd even suggest this after what happened.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: You make it sound like it was my fault. It hangs in the air. Maybe it was?

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: I was practically begging. But you wouldn't listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: And you think Terry would have listened to me? Candice looks at him with hurt eyes. Elaine backs off.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Alright. Let’s say you make it out the building. Across to the Marina. Down to the dock. We find a boat and everything... Then what?

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Then we get the hell out of Dodge.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: To where? Catalina? Down the coast?

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Anywhere is better than here.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: How do you know? We’re here and we're still alive.  70.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: I guess I have faith, Oliver. Thought you might understand that. Whether it’s intended as a mock, Oliver takes it as such.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Listen to me you little punk- VRRROOSH! A sonic boom echoes from outside. The sound of something FLYING OVERHEAD. And fast.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: What was that? Oliver hustles to the TELESCOPE. He pans across the sky, struggling to find the source of the sound. Jarrod picks up the remote. Looks at Elaine. She doesn’t protest this time. He turns on the TV. Everyone watches t telescope feed on the screen to see: MILITARY PREDATOR DRONES.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Hallelujah. A whole squadron of PREDATORS, flying over the city towar the MOTHERSHIP. WHOMP. WHOMP. The Frequency sounds. The PREDATORS are quickly inundated with SIREN LIGHTS but they just keep coming.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: The light... it’s not stopping them...

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: They’re unmanned.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: It’s about time. Oliver pans the telescope over. Everyone GASPS. HUNDREDS OF HYDRA ships swarm, blotting out the sky.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Oh... shit.  71. It’s not a dogfight. It’s a massacre. The HYDRA don’t sho any projectiles. They KAMIKAZE into each Predator Drone. EXPLOSIONS scatter across the sky. One by one the Predato are dive bombed by the Hydra.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: No, no, no! Oliver whips the telescope back and forth following the action with a growing sense of horror. His hopes and pray unraveling before his very eyes. He centers on the SOLE REMAINING PREDATOR as it weaves through an endless sea of Hydra ships. Everyone holds their breath. Bobbing. Weaving.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, come on... But it can only last for so long. A wave of Hydra engulf The Predator cheats death for a second longer. Launches a MISSILE before... BOOM! The Predator explodes in a burst of black smoke. Oliver struggles with the focus trying to follow the Miss as it HITS THE MOTHERSHIP over DOWNTOWN LOS ANGELES. FLASH. Everything blows out to WHITE. The TV DIES. THE POWER GOES OUT. Nuclear EMP. Oliver looks away, stunned. Dives to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everybody down! The HEAT WAVE rips across the city. The building SHAKES VIOLENTLY. ONE of the WINDOW BLINDS FALLS to the floor, exposing the for the first time. Everyone else ducks down. The howling wind is deafening. Jarrod and Elaine make eye contact, expecting the worst. Then, the shaking stops.  72. Jarrod rushes to the exposed window.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Jarrod! He stops short, looks back at her. Slowly peers around to the MUSHROOM CLOUD over DOWNTOWN. The Westchester BLUFFS shielded them from the brunt of the blast.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Oh my God... The MOTHERSHIP spiral through the air, across the entire skyline before CRASHING into Culver City 4 miles away. Oliver scans the wreckage with the telescope.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: It... It worked. He turns to Elaine. She hugs Oliver. Jarrod takes note. Elaine looks for herself. Sure enough the Ship is down.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: I don’t believe it. Turns to Jarrod and Candice.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want to see? Tears of joy well up in Candice’s eyes. She shakes her he

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: I‘1l take your word for it. Jarrod steps between Oliver and Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: You mind?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: By all means Boss. Oliver moves out of the way. Jarrod looks through the Telescope. Oliver and Elaine exchange hopeful looks.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Do you think there’s more where those guys came from?  73. For a long beat Jarrod pans across the wreckage.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Sure. Now they know what to do. Jarrod stops on the downed ship. Adjust the focus. Sighs.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shouldn’t be long before help- Jarrod pulls his head away. A look of deep loss on his fa

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Are you alright? Jarrod just shakes his head. A concerned Oliver bends over to peer through the scope. TELESCOPE POV: The MOTHERSHIP is strewn across the hills with HUNDREDS OF TANKERS, HYDRAS, and DRONES spilling fro its fractured HULL.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What... what is it? Jarrod looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: They’re not dead. TELESCOPE POV: HUNDREDS OF THEM move in a murderous WAVE destruction down the hill, SWARMING across the city, righ towards them.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just really, really pissed off. TELESCOPE POV: Oliver pans back to the crashed ship to se SOMETHING rising from the wreckage.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Something’s happening... TELESCOPE POV: A darker, mysterious LIGHT pulses above th ship. A strange energy fills the air. The ship’s DEBRIS suddenly RISES UP, spinning around the SIREN in a zero gravity centrifugal vortex as: THE SHIP BEGINS TO REBUILD ITSELF. Oliver takes a deep, labored breath. Like the hope is suc out of him. Doesn’t know what to say. Then...  74.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We.... We have to block the window. But Jarrod can see the resurgent ship through the window clear as day. Elaine looks back at Jarrod. Fear in her ey

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey. Come on, help me with this. Oliver grabs a stool from the kitchen. Begins trying to reattached the blinds. But Jarrod just walks away.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get back here! Candice rushes over to help Oliver attach a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrod packs his duffel bag. Elaine enters, devastated from the totality of the situat She watches him packing her things into his bag as well.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: (Frightened) What are you doing? He stops, looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: The only thing we can do. He walks past her into the:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrod walks out, bag in hand. Elaine follows.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Going somewhere? Candice and Oliver join them. Oliver is covered in sweat. exposed window is now covered by a BLANKET.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Those things are coming for us.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: And you're going to run away?  75.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: I’m not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: We stay here. We hold up. For good. Elaine nods. Jarrod turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: So now he gets to decide? We have no water, no power-—

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: But you saw what’s out there-

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Yeah, and I’d rather make a run for it than stay in a twenty story target. Between those things and the radiation, we are dead up here. Elaine looks to Oliver then back to Jarrod. Uncertainty o her face.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: I don't- A RUMBLING SOUND reverberates from outside the windows. Everyone stops in their tracks. The sound grows louder. Jarrod moves towards the windows. Follows the sound into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From here he can hear the whirling blades. Then, through crack in the blinds, he sees

dialogues.speaker: A BLACK HAWK HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Touching down on the neighboring roof of the REGATTA BUILDING.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Get in here! He pulls the blinds back, peeking around to make sure the coast is clear. Elaine, Oliver, and Candice enter the room.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look...  76. On the REGATTA ROOF: THREE SOLDIERS, with thermal goggles and gas masks, armed the teeth, emerge from the CHOPPER. Jarrod goes to open the MASTER PATIO DOOR. Oliver grabs t handle.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: What the hell do you think you’re doing?

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: We got to let ‘em know we’re here.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: You'll let everything know. We can’t attract any attention. Jarrod looks to Elaine, uncertainly on her face.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: You've been saying to wait for help. Well, help is here- He tries to push past Oliver but he won’t budge.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Does that look like a rescue chopper to you? Don’t you get it? This is a war. They stare each other down.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Where are they going? They turn to look across as the Chopper RISES UP, taking flight. Jarrod watches in vain before spotting... The THREE SOLDIERS quickly and efficiently move across th rooftop into spotting positions.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: They’1l be back for them. Come on, we have to hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrod moves across the living room. Gathers his stuff.  77.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: We'll go to the roof. Get them to pick us up. Candice shakes her head. Elaine isn’t sure anymore.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: What if they don’t come back?

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Elaine-

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Look what happened to those planes. What good is a helicopter?

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: We have to take that chance. Oliver steps towards Jarrod.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: You can’t make that choice.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Seriously, just back off. We're going. The BLANKET BLIND falls from the window. Outside they see the still REBUILDING MOTHERSHIP is now HALFWAY COMPLETE - its massive shadow looming over the ci

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Shit! Candice runs over. Struggles to reattach the blanket. Oliver looks to the exposed window, pissed off, then back Jarrod.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: You just gonna stand there?

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: What do we do when the other blinds fall? We don’t have enough bed sheets. Jarrod steps forward, GRABBING Elaine by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on.  78. She pulls her arm away. Holds her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: How can you be so sure?

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Baby- Jarrod goes to grab Elaine’s arm again.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Stop! Oliver steps in between them.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: You heard the lady. Jarrod looks to Oliver in disbelief. Turns to Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She’s not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: That’s not up to you. He pushes past Oliver towards Elaine. Oliver pushes back.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Stop it, both of you!

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: I’m not gonna let you put her in danger. Not in her condition.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: This isn’t your family! Oliver BACKHANDS him across the face. Jarrod touches his lip. Reaches for Elaine again.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Elaine, come on- Oliver puts his hand on Jarrod’s chest. Jarrod SWINGS bac cracking Oliver in the jaw. A nice punch but not a knock

dialogues.speaker: JARROD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I said back off!

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Jarrod!  79. Oliver looks to Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: It’s alright. Jarrod looks to Oliver. Then defiantly steps to Elaine ag

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Baby, we have to- Oliver grabs Jarrod’s shirt. Delivers TWO crushing PUNCHE his face. Jarrod falls to the ground. Oliver turns his back.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Stay down, Boss. Jarrod groans. Doubled over in pain. He pulls himself up. Elaine rushes to him but Oliver holds her back with his a

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Get off of me! Elaine beats her hands against his back.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, but it’s for the best. Jarrod wipes his bloodied face. Stands up, unbalanced.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Let her go! Oliver puts Elaine down. Raises his arms. Ready to brawl.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: You just don’t get it, do you? Jarrod stares Oliver down.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: You can hit me all you want. Looks into Elaine’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I’m not giving up on my family. Jarrod lowers his fists, extending his arm out to Elaine. A long pause as Jarrod stares into Elaine's eyes.  80. She looks back, seeing the boy she loves become a man. In spite of all apprehension, she takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: I am with you. He caresses her cheek. They embrace and kiss. Oliver hangs his head. Jarrod stares back at Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: (to Oliver) You're just gonna let them leave? Jarrod and Elaine run for the door. Jarrod tosses the bookshelf out of the way. He swings the door open. Looks back to Oliver one last time.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: They are making a choice. (he nods to Jarrod) Gotta respect that. The doors shuts. Oliver walks to the exposed window. The almost complete MOTHERSHIP begins to rise upwards as plethora of CREATURES continue tearing across the city in wave of destruction. He pans back up to the SOLDIERS on t neighboring rooftop. He turns to Candice.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How about that cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emergency lights flash. Smoke fills the air. A MUFFLED SMASH. Jarrod elbows the emergency glass. Picks up a FIRE AXE.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Come on.  81. They share a look. Elaine nods. They head up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door slowly opens. Jarrod peeks out. Followed by Elai It's deceptively serene. But they can hear the sounds of BATTLE off in the distance. Jarrod grabs a BRICK to wedge the door open. Just in case

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Alright, just stay low and follow me. Elaine nods. Looks like she’s going to lose it. He gently holds her face in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can do this. I know you can. She swallows her fear, wiping a tear out of her eye. Nods

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s go. Jarrod leads her crouching under the helipad. They move towards the COOLING SYSTEM. Staying low and kee covered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver stubs out his cigarette. Notices a red ring on the filter. His lip is bleeding. Candice looks towards the Regatta roof.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Do you think they’1l help them?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Doesn’t matter. From now on... He stands. Stares into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s just you and me. Oliver nods before walking off towards the bathroom.  82. Candice looks back to the Regatta’s roof before her eyes settle on the TELESCOPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, the MOTHER SHIP continues to REBUILD. Jarrod and Elaine crouch along the south edge of the roof just twenty yards away from the Regatta Building. Jarrod slowly rises up, peeking over the railing.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: (whispers) Do you see anyone? Jarrod’s eyes scan the neighboring rooftop to see A SOLDI with an RPG on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Hey! The Soldier spins, weapon trained on Jarrod.

dialogues.speaker: RPG SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Don’t move! The other TWO SOLDIERS emerge from their positions, each armed with Barrett Light 50 SNIPER RIFLES.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Hey! Whoa! Easy! He looks to Elaine. She slowly rises up next to him

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Please... We need help. The Soldiers trade looks. One picks up his RADIO. Eyes trained on Elaine. Calls something in but we can’t hear i The RADIO SQUAWKS back. Muffled conversation between the Soldiers gives way to debate. All in MOS. Accusations fly back and forth as TWO of the SOLDIERS STA OFF with each other, FINGERS POINTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver dabs his lip with rubbing alcohol. Stings. Looks at his reflection. Rubs away the blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TELESCOPE POV: Clumsily panning up along the building nex door’s rooftop. The SOLDIERS stand out in the open, an ARGUMENT taking place between them. It’s getting heated. Suddenly there’s a flash of movement. Candice looks up, then back into the eye piece. She aims telescope over. Then stops. Twitches for a moment. VEINS protrude across her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver exits the bathroom and stops. Turns to look into t CLOSET. He walks inside. It’s the size of his bedroom. Runs his hand along a custo built rack of overpriced shoes. Shakes his head. SSSD! He hears the sound of the PATIO DOOR sliding open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver runs out of the master bedroom to see: CANDICE standing on the patio. SIREN LIGHT pouring over h face.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: No, no, no-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine and Jarrod stand with their arms still raised as t SOLDIERS ARGUE amongst each other on the neighboring roof

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOLDIERS hear the SCREAM and spring into action, runn over towards the north side of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver closes his eyes and steps outside. Blindly reachin for her.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Give me your hand! He grabs her arm, pulling her back but: She is VIOLENTLY RIPPED away from his grip. Candice spirals out from the balcony, through the air, th SHE'S SWALLOWED into the pupas sac of a hovering DRONE.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! The now full Drone rises upwards, flying off. Oliver watches in despair when: BOOM! The Drone explodes in mid-air. Oliver crouches. His eyes darting up the VAPOR TRAIL back the RPG SOLDIER standing on the Regatta roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrod falls atop of Elaine, instinctively shielding her. They share a look. Then slowly rise up. On the Regatta Roof, the RPG SOLDIER meets their gaze.

dialogues.speaker: RPG SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Stay down! They’re coming! Jarrod and Elaine nod, looking up to see the BLACK HAWK FLYING towards them from across the Marina. Elaine allows herself to smile. Jarrod holds her tight. The chopper BLADES WHIRL loudly as it angles between the buildings, heading towards the COVE’s helipad. SNNRRT! Long and sinewy TENDRILS wrap around the Black Ha  85. A TANKER crests the roof of the Regatta with its outstret TENDRIL CLAW, holding the BLACK HAWK in mid air. SNIPER FIRE rips into the Tanker as the SOLDIERS unload o it. BOOM! The RPG SOLDIER fires at the TANKER, knocking it to edge of the roof. It teeters there for a long tense momen The TANKER GROWLS! Grabbing the RPG SOLDIER with its othe claw before FALLING OFF the roof and RIPPING the Black Ha down with it.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: No! Jarrod and Elaine watch helplessly as the CHOPPER FALLS.. All... the... way... down. It CRASHES hard into the groun A fireball rises upwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver looks down the crashed CHOPPER with hardened eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TWO Remaining Soldiers reload their weapons. Elaine and Jarrod stand in shock for a moment. Behind them, the now REBUILT MOTHERSHIP hovers towards th Before they can even process it, the building starts to S VIOLENTLY.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Jarrod!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHAKING throws Oliver against the railing. CRASH. CRASH. The sounds growing louder... Oliver looks down to see: ANOTHER TANKER IS CLIMBING UP THE SIDE OF THE BUILDING.  86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine helps Jarrod to his feet. He reaches down for the Jarrod and Elaine grab each other by the hand.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Come on! They hustle back across the shaking roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver stumbles into the rumbling condo as ALL of the WIN BLINDS FALL DOWN exposing the entire view. The SHADOW of the MOTHERSHIP envelops the entire landscap He clutches his cross. Resolve washing over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrod and Elaine hustle towards the ROOF DOOR when: BOOM! BOOM! They look out to see an AIRCRAFT CARRIER on t COAST LINE. Navy warships are fighting the Hydra. The entire skyline is filled with the unfolding battle. Our last stand. But they don’t have time to watch. Elaine opens the roof door to see: THE SAVAGE DRONE from the garage - a long SCAR across its body - moving right for them. Elaine turns and slams the door but its TENDRIL slips thr the open crack, wrapping around her waist. SIREN LIGHT seeps through the bullet holes as Jarrod and Elaine push back against the door. Jarrod slams the AXE down, chopping the TENDRIL off. The Drone HOWLS! Elaine throws the severed tendril to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: This way!  87. They turn and run back through the ventilation system. The DRONE SMASHES through the doorway. Its bleeding stump flails out, slithering over the SEVERE TENDRIL. With a grotesque crunch, the tendril REATTACHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver shuffles a CIGARETTE out of Candice’s pack. Standing behind the stove counter top. He turns on the ga Holds the cigarette in his mouth. One last smoke. Oliver lifts the LIGHTER to his face. About to spark it. CRASH! The TANKER’S CLAW smashes through the WINDOWS. Its massive TENDRIL sails right past Oliver’s head. He falls back. The LIGHTER scatters across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ROOFTOP —- SUNSET Jarrod and Elaine jump over steaming pipes and vents as t DRONE gives chase. Elaine's pants get caught on a vent. She stumbles. The SIREN LIGHT flares through the STEAM. Jarrod turns back to help her up. Ripping her pants loose They ROUND A CORNER to the front of the building. THE MOTHERSHIP is CLOSING IN, almost right overhead. Jarrod points to the Window Washer SCAFFOLDING held down cinder blocks.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Come on, it’s the only way down. Jarrod begins kicking off the cinder blocks when: VOOSH! A TENDRIL stabs right through his THIGH.  88. He SCREAMS in pain, falling back as the DRONE rounds the corner. Elaine is on one side, Jarrod the other.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Elaine run! THE DRONE looms over Jarrod, its SIREN LIGHT floods him. Jarrod is ENTRANCED. Eyes bloodshot. Veins bulging. The TENDRIL ENVELOPS his head. Pulling him in. Elaine looks to Jarrod, then the Drone. She’s had enough. THUMP. She smashes the AXE into the DRONE’S HEAD. It lets a HOWL! Releasing Jarrod. Elaine twists the handle, yanks the AXE back. Embedded on the blade is a BRAIN MATTER. Nerve endings dangling. All HUMAN in appearance.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Oh my God... The dying DRONE whips its TENDRIL, knocking her back. It pounces on top of her. It’s PUPAS SAC opening, trying swallow her inside. The still entranced Jarrod trembles. Rises to his feet. Overcoming everything, he pushes forward. The sight of hi woman in danger, sending him to another place.

dialogues.speaker: GET OFF HER
dialogues.text: Jarrod tackles the Drone off of Elaine, pinning it to the ground. The Drone bores into Jarrod’s flesh but there’s n stopping him. Jarrod stares right into the SIREN LIGHT. Using the stren against it. He TEARS at the DRONE’S FACE, ripping away it eyes. BRUTALLY BREAKING it’s face apart with his bare han SMASHING DOWN. Again and again. Till there’s nothing but oil and goo beneath him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TANKER reaches through the windows, shaking everythin  89. Oliver crawls across the floor. Reaches for the LIGHTER. CUTLERY BLOCK falls to the ground, carving knives nearly slicing off his fingers. He pulls back his hand. Close ca SNAP! The Tanker’s TENDRIL wraps around his ankle, pullin him across the floor. Oliver is yanked through the living room, all the way aga the shattered windows. At the last second, 50 CAL FIRE rips into the Tanker’s ba from the TWO SNIPERS on the Regatta Roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tanker turns to look at the SNIPERS with FURIOUS EYES SNNNRT! Its TENDRILS WHIP across to the Regatta Roof - debraining the FIRST SNIPER - then whipping the remains i the SECOND, sending him FLYING off the roof. His SCREAMS drown out as he falls to the city below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver stretches to grip a CARVING KNIFE. Stabs it throug the TANKER’S TENDRIL. It HISSES. Oliver turns and runs back through the living room. The TANKER thrusts its arm after him. THE CLAW stabs through Oliver’s TORSO, pinning him down. With his last gasp, Oliver reaches out and grabs the LIGH Looks up at the ugly motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Vaya con Dios, you son of a bitch- SPARK. BOOM!!! The entire penthouse EXPLODES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tanker HOWLS! Engulfed in a burst of FLAMES. EXT. ROOFTOP —- SUNSET Jarrod and Elaine are knocked back by the EXPLOSION right beneath them. The building rumbles and shakes.  90. They hold on to each other tightly, watching helplessly a the SCAFFOLDING FALLS OVER the edge.

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: No! Jarrod lunges forward. Elaine grabs him. Holds him in her arms. Cuts all over his body. He struggles to catch his breath, coming down from the rage of the entrancement. Jarrod looks down at his leg. He’s bleeding pretty badly. CRUNCH! The CLAW of the BURNT TANKER grips the roof's edg

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Get up! She drags Jarrod to his feet. The BURNT TANKER crests onto the roof. Charred flesh. Ang as hell. They run up the stairs to the:

dialogues.speaker: HELIPAD
dialogues.text: Running across to the opposite end. Jarrod collapses. Fac white as a sheet. The BURNT TANKER bears down on them. WHOMP. WHOMP. The Frequency sounds from above. Elaine looks up to see: THE MOTHERSHIP IS OVERHEAD. A SQUADRON of FIGHTER JETS move towards it. But they too kamikazed by the Hydra - exploding in the sky above them. SHRAPNEL RAINS DOWN ONTO THE HELIPAD. Now it’s Elaine’s turn to shield Jarrod... As the BURNT TANKER goes in for the kill... SMASH! A DOWNED FIGHTER JET CRASHES right into the TANKER knocking it off the roof, plummeting to the cul de sac be Elaine opens her eyes. Surprised to still be alive. She holds Jarrod in her arms. Life draining from his body

dialogues.speaker: JARROD
dialogues.text: Please Elaine... you have to go.  91.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: I’m not going anywhere without you. They embrace. Sharing a tender moment. HOWL! Another TANKER crawls up the Regatta building to th south. And another TANKER on the building to the north. OFF THE COAST: The AIRCRAFT CARRIER sinks into the Pacifi All the Fighter Jets are down. Our last stand has failed. There is no escape. Elaine and Jarrod hold each other tight. The incandescent SIREN SPHERE gently falls from the MOTHERSHIP'S belly, descending towards them. Time stands still for a moment. It's harrowing. And beautiful. They stare into each other's eyes. A lifetime passing between them as they kiss. Then... they look up into the SIREN. The trance overcomes them. Veins protruding across their bodies. But they don’t let go of each other. WHOOSH! They're pulled up together through the air. Spiralling upwards over the building and the howling Tank Over the decimated city of Los Angeles. Up into the clouds as the SIREN light flares out the lens

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises over the rooftops as a DRONE scurries past. a single person in sight.  92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TANKER is perched atop the Empire State Building overlooking the desolate city below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Eiffel Tower looms above empty streets, eclipsed by a HYDRA flying upwards across the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast shadow drifts over the Taj Mahal. Tilting up to the MOTHERSHIPS, now slowly moving on, like stuffed predators slithering away until their next meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The once humming metropolis is now completely barren. Not creature stirring. Human beings have been wiped off the face of the Earth. FADE TO BLACK. Then... SCANNER POV: like 4D ultrasound meets x-ray vision, looki down on some kind of strange CONVEYOR BELT. HUMAN BODY after BODY passes through the scanner head fir An assembly line. We can see right through their skin, scanning over the br then the organs, muscles, etc. They look like nothing mor than animals. A familiar looking WOMAN passes through the scan. It pass over her stomach to focus on a SECOND HEART BEAT. She’s pregnant. The conveyor belt STOPS. Strange noises echo through the chamber. Shadows engulf h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of ELAINE’S EYES as they flutter open. She squints, still reeling from the effects of the siren light. Laying on her back, she tries to sit up. But she can’t mo muscle. Her eyes begin to focus on the strange biomechanical environment. Everything pulses with energy, like the enti ship is alive. She recoils at the sight of: HUNDREDS OF HEADLESS HUMAN BODIES. The wounds cauterized. Then... a DOME HEADED BEING sits before her. A horrifying of metal and musculature that we haven’t seen before. A surgical INCISION cut through the center of its cranium Its large oval eyes are shut tightly. Beside it, TENDRILS reach into a viscous TROUGH to retrie HUMAN BRAIN with spinal nerve endings still attached. The human nervous system is slowly inserted inside the BEING’S CRANIUM. The TENDRIL seals the wound instantly. The Being stirs. Looks up, opening its large humanoid EYE It tilts its head, considering her for moment. The BEING turns and bounds across the chamber, murdering DRONES in its path. It turns and stares at Elaine. She gasps in horror. Her e widening in fear as the BEING LOOMS over her. With two slashes she’s freed from her constraints. She looks up, staring into its EYES. The BEING bends down. Reaches out to gently caress her ch

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: (Whispers) Jarrod...? TO BE CONTINUED...
